reviews.sentence: I would not recommend this hotel no upkeep and unfriendly staff. Location was fine and the grounds were kept up and the cleaning staff did the best they could with what they had to work with. Refrigerator was not cold enough to keep items in the freezer frozen and the frig part was not cold. Unfriendly and unhelpful front desk. No upkeep on the building tubs finish was coming off bathroom tiles missing cracked doors it was terrible. On the website it looks like there is beachfront. there is none. Pool is tiny.

Great location shame about the hotel. Well located being just 60 feet from the ocean. Very near to Theatre of the Sea. Surly unhelpful staff who gave us the impression that they thought their guests were a hindrance to their working day. Tiny room with no room on one side to get past the bed. Decrepit air conditioning unit. There is no breakfast option. Coffee in a flask from 830am was all you got. If you ask for hot water to make a cup of tea instead of a coffee you are met with a blank look.

You should drive past this one. We had to use extreme force to pull open the door it was warped at the bottom. Room smelled musty. Paint was peeling off bathroom walls and window would not stay open and was cracked. Room A C unit was too small for hole in wall so light and bugs entered through openings. Extremely rusty medicine cabinet in bathroom. Coffee pot was there but no coffee or filters provided. Beds were very uncomfortable need new mattresses. Owner was very cold and uncaring. Closet door was broken. Totally misrepresented on web pictures do not match what is really there. Pool was dirty.

OK for location hotel room needs more maintenance. This hotel is not worth the money the stay was OK so far for the location but the room had the following issues like bathroom with many wall defects painting bad water drain in the shower room ventilation by a small window which could be opened but did not stayopen old and noicy aircondition you could nealy feel the spring in the matres door was very difficult to close open was not adjusted no room service in the bathrom no cafe pads no shampoos etc only for the first night no WiFi at the room only in the area of the hotel reception Ice machine was only allowed to use for the small white container not even for smaller coolers.

Wifi did not work very well if you were in one of the cabins. Also beds were very soft and kind of caved in around the edge not great. The rooms however were quite clean and I would rate this an average stay.
VERY WELCOMING STAFF BUT HOTEL NEEDS A HUGE UPGRAD. NO PHONE IN THE ROOM CLOSES AT 10PM EVERYNIGHT AND NO FOOD SERVED OR NEAR. U HAVE TO DRIVE TO SURVIVE.

Be forewarned no cancellations. The woman at the desk was very responsive to our concerns about various issues. She should be commended for trying to make the best of a tough situation. The place is in serious need of renovation. As they say details matter and this place was probably in good shape in the 60s or 70s but not much has been done since. Tv did not work a c did. but it is very rundown and worn out so be forewarned. If your standards are low you will be happy. The inability to cancel your reservation at any time is a big red flag that should not be overlooked.

Not a good experience. Nothing. Not very clean. The exterior was dirty needs painting. The bathroom ceiling was flaking off. No stopper in bathroom sink. Sheets were threadbare and see through. Mattress was not very comfortable. Sliding door and blinds to outdoor balcony could not be opened. Wall air conditioner was so loud it was not possible to hear the tv. No coffee in the room. Would never recommend or stay there again. Outdoor Stairs to 3rd floor were not clean. Large garbage can right outside our room.

Average accommodation with superior view. Nice outdoor area with lounge chairs. Bathroom faucets leaked. Toilet was slow flushing. Door handle in bathroom was loose. There was trash in the boat basin.

Toilet seat broken and got cut. Air conditioning old and noisy. Very old furnishings TV was pre flat screen. Suggestion Update rooms. BUT Pool area was BEAUTIFUL and young woman at front desk was lovely. pool restaurants shopping near by walking distanceMid way to Key West. update rooms.

Location location location. Stayed in a cute little villa. Was clean and had beautiful view of ocean. Rooms recently renovated after destruction from Irma. Amazing view. Friendly staff and access to kayaks SUP ’s. Only criticism is so close to the highway. Could hear the traffic buzzing by there was even a massive accident right in front. The proximity to the hey though I think is standard for most places in Islamorada. Not too many trees on property either but I think that will come with regrowth.
Staff was super nice and accommodating for our late night check in. Rooms are clearly newly renovated and very clean and comfortable.

A peaceful well maintained place to stay that I would recommend to anyone. I will be back. Islamorada is my favorite key and the Fisher Inn is perfectly located to be private and quiet enough away from the hub bub yet close enough to everything. It has it is own private stretch of beach with plenty of chairs some outdoor games a couple small mangrove islands nearby and a well kept pool. I thoroughly enjoyed a wonderful villa where I felt like I was living on that private beach. Beautiful peaceful well maintained property. Every room and villa and lobby is renovated and new. Friendly staff and a very relaxed vibe rounded out a most wonderful stay for my Birthday weekend. Big ThanksI am a guy who likes a hot breakfast so that would be the only improvement I would see. There are good muffins pastries and coffee in a nice room and you are free to help yourself. It was a generous breakfast in that sense just not the eggs and bacon type breakfast. So I would not say I did not like the breakfast just a preference for me.

Good service saved the day. We recently stayed at four hotels in the Florida Keys Lime Tree Bay Resort Tranquility Bay Ocean Pointe Suites at Ke Largo and the Fisher Inn. The Fisher Inn was the most contemporary and newly renovated in a simple and casual beach chic style. It was clean and very well appointed with free kayaks padleboards games a marina pool and colorful beach area. We had a glitch in our stay and thestaf and management responded amazingly a particular shout out to Eta and Jesica. Mistakes can happen anywhere but these people have truly personalized service. I recommend this for a fun and casual stay in the Keys with a smaller feel. One point with plastic being a major issue would love to see the hotel and all others. forego stirrers styrofoam travel size toiletries in favor of sustainable products and refilable toiletry gel lotion shampoo etc dispensers.

Quaint tranquility in the middle of it all. We stayed in a villa at Fisher Inn. It was on the beach with a beautiful ocean view. It was incredibly clean too. This was our first time staying here and we loved it. It felt quaint but had really nice accommodations and amenities. It was quiet and the staff was great. We will definitely be returning. We have stayed at other pricier places in Islamorada but Fisher Inn is just as worthy. it is a tranquil piece of paradise that is still pretty low on tourists radar. I am sure that will change quickly. Great place highly recommend. We will be back.

Incredible place to stay in Islamorada. Fisher Inn is like a dream come true. it is perfectly located quiet modern and super clean while still having a bit of old school charm. I stayed in one of the little villas and loved it. The beds was comfortable bathroom was pristine and other small amenities made me feel like it was a home away from home. The pool was clean and quiet with a polite and respectful guests. Around the property were all kinds of simple and fun activities like a giant chess board corn hole hammocks and lounge chairs looking out toward the water. The staff was super friendly and hospitable so much so that they provided our crew with carafes of coffee and breakfast items on our work days that required a 5 am wake up call. In todays time there are not too many places that will go that extra mile with customer service. Needless to say we will definitely be back and are happy to recommend the Fisher Inn to everyone.

New Old School Charm. We loved the old school charm here. It reminded us of the places we used to stay with our families growing up. Our room gave us great views of both the Gulf and the Atlantic right from our balcony. The bed is comfortable and the room is clean modern and stylish. Great amenities include a full size fridge in the room a microwave a two burner stovetop and sink. The Inn is close to a Publix market as well as all kinds of restaurants. We also enjoyed the ping pong table corn hole and beach chairs overlooking the Atlantic. Kayaks paddle boards and bikes are also available. The resort includes a boat dock. The staff is super friendly.

Nice but avoid room 115. Amenities kayaks breakfast bicycles cleanlinesUnfortunately we were given the room that has the fire alarm system next to it room 115. The system is mounted directly above the bed on the outside of the cabana on a thin wall. This fire alarm system runs constantly and makes a loud noise that is extremely disturbing at night. Impossible to sleep as all you can hear is the constant noise from the system. It ruins the whole experience of staying in a wild location. The next morning we explained the situation to the front desk and we got a symbolic small refund on the price of the reservation. Although we appreciate the gesture the refund was too little to really show the intention from the management to resolve the matter in a fair way. The right way to handle the problem would have been to give at least a 50 refund which did not happen. The fact is that it is not fair that room 115 is available for booking. This room should never be offered to paying customers. It is absolutely not fair and we suggested the management to remove this room from the available bookings for future customers. If you stay there simply be cautious upon booking to request any rooms but the 115.

Exceptional. The check in was efficient and friendly everything smelled nice. The room was big and clean with two double beds and a kitchen area. We had ocean view room 210 with a large balcony. Lovely pool area. Good place to eat just a 10 minute walk away. We are travelling around Florida staying at 11 hotels motels this is number 8 and definitely the best so far We liked everything about this place. On this trip we have stayed in places way more expensive and no comparison in standard of accommodation to Fisher inn.

great place for a reasonable price. They upgraded our room complimentary. Breakfast was really nice although simple. Coffee was great Outdoor breakfast area provides roof and great view to the ocean. Quiet and super clean. We enjoied free bikes and pedal boards as it was all newno complains.
